summary:
Expresses concern about internally displaced persons and refugees, and calls for cooperation with humanitarian agencies.

 Demands Mr. Gbagbo lift the siege of Golf Hotel.

 Imposes targeted sanctions on individuals obstructing peace, violating human rights, or inciting hatred and violence.

 Remains seized of the matter.
The Security Council document 1975 (2011) Annex I lists individuals subject to targeted sanctions for their roles in obstructing the peace and reconciliation process in Côte d’Ivoire. 
1. Laurent Gbagbo, former President, for obstruction of the peace process and rejection of presidential election results.
2. Simone Gbagbo, Chairperson of the Ivorian Popular Front Parliamentary Group, for obstruction of the peace process and public incitement to hatred and violence.
3. Désiré Tagro, Secretary-General in Gbagbo’s “presidency”, for participation in Gbagbo’s illegitimate government, obstruction of the peace process, and participation in violent repressions.
4. Pascal Affi N’Guessan, Chairman of the Ivorian Popular Front, for obstruction of the peace process and incitement to hatred and violence.
5. Alcide Djédjé, close advisor to Gbagbo, for participation in Gbagbo’s illegitimate government and public incitement to hatred and violence.
